Title: Data Analyst, Global Partnerships & Content
Description:
The Global Partnerships & Content organization at Meta works closely with the leading content creators and media entities in the world to build and grow innovative and meaningful content and community engagement experiences across a variety of product areas. The Strategy & Operations team within the Global Partnerships & Content organization seeks a data analyst to support day-to-day analysis and business insights needs. In this role, you will conduct analysis to inform organizational goals, build dashboards and data reporting, and drive deep dive analysis to support the business strategy.

Data Analyst, Global Partnerships & Content Responsibilities:


Develop subject matter expertise in key partner ecosystem metrics across Meta’s Family of Apps.
Deliver regular insights that inform creator and media partnerships strategy.
Build dashboards and reports to track effectiveness and efficiency improvements over time, and guide future decisions.
Establish close working relationships with a variety of cross-functional stakeholders including partner management, data engineering, and product development teams.


Minimum Qualifications:


3+ years of experience querying SQL databases.
3+ years of experience working in an analytical capacity developing insights, defining metrics, and making recommendations.
Presentation and communications experience with extracting insights from technical data sets to varied audiences.
Demonstrated experience thinking strategically about complex issues, leading to thoughtful recommendations and action plans.


Preferred Qualifications:


Management consulting or sales operations background.


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$104,000/year to $146,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: (Sr.) Data Analyst
Description:
Location: 10250 Constellation Blvd., Century City, Los Angeles, US (3 days in the office-hybrid)




About This Role

BIGO LIVE is seeking a talented, curious Business Intelligence Analyst who thrives at the intersection of data, product, engineering, and operations. The team is data-driven and results focused. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical, analytical, and operations background – with a hunger to make our platform grow. This position is full-time and is located at our Los Angeles office.




Responsibilities

Independently own internal team data using SQL, Python, Excel and provide ongoing reporting
Create and manage data pipelines in Excel, SQL or Python to aggregate data for different operations team
Build, maintain and provide data for the internal operations teams, interact with internal users to establish and clarify requirements in order to develop report specifications
Ensure the KPI & metrics are aligned across the different business functions in the operations team
Advise leaders and support decisions for launches of in-app initiatives
Understand ecosystems, behaviors, and long-term trends of live-stream content




Qualifications:

BA or BS degree in a quantitative field: data science, finance, information systems, mathematics, statistics or similar
At least 3 years analyst experience (combination of techincal and practical experience i.e. finding insights and presenting to leaders), preferred 5
Experience using SQL, Excel(spreadsheets), and at least one scripting language such as Python, R, javascript, etc.
Proficient in converting data sets into actionable business insights
Experience presenting reports and analyses to a non-technical audience
Experience with navigating ambiguity through data-driven decision making and adaptable to fast paced environment
Great communication and team-work skills




Benefits:

Competitive pay package that includes a base salary and performance-related bonus.
Generous paid time off starting at 4 weeks + 10 sick days and 9 Holidays per year.
Free medical, dental, and vision insurance
401k
Free gym membership

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
About Flexport:

At Flexport, we believe global trade can move the human race forward. That’s why it’s our mission to make global commerce so easy there will be more of it. We’re shaping the future of a $8.6T industry with solutions powered by innovative technology and exceptional people. Today, companies of all sizes - from emerging brands to Fortune 500s - use Flexport technology to move more than $19B of merchandise across 112 countries a year.

The recent global supply chain crisis has put Flexport center stage as we continue to play a pivotal role in how goods move around the world. At a valuation of $8 billion, we’re experiencing record growth and are proud to have the support of the best investors in the game who believe in our mission, solutions and people. Ready to tackle global challenges that impact business, society, and the environment? Come join us.

Creating insights to revolutionize an industry!

The opportunity:

Fast, accurate insights are integral in allowing us to fulfill our mission of fixing the user experience in global trade. At Flexport you’ll conduct analyses that are at the forefront of reshaping the entire logistics & supply chain industries. You’ll work alongside self-starters interested in solving real-world problems and streamlining the inefficiencies in the complex global trade industry. You’ll have the opportunity to improve an industry by analyzing the new operating system for global trade.

You will:


Flexport is a company that runs on data - you'll be transforming data into action by working cross-functionally with the entirety of Flexport.
Meet with stakeholders - from business and product - to understand OKR requirements and convert them into analytical solutions
Model new product analytics datasets built on our proprietary operations software to optimize growth strategies and cost reductions
Improve operational and financial productivity across our business and software
Rapid prototype new functionality via dashboards to enable new ways of working and discover best practices for workflow management across all of Flexport's departments;
Contribute and grow the culture of excellence on our team by bringing processes and best practices to our group.
Drive highly visible projects for Flexport
Influence the roadmap for both the Data Analytics department and the stakeholders we support


You should have:


2-5 years of experience in a Data Analyst, BI Engineer, Product Analyst, or similar role
Strong SQL fluency required – from building entire ERDs of tables containing complex logic to analyzing those datasets into consumable insights for the business.
Professional familiarity with applied statistics and scripting languages like Python or R (python preferred)
Experience ELT data modeling, especially with dbt (data build tool) is a plus; building analytical narratives using data visualizations (Looker is a plus)
Executive communication skills and empathy to understand and discover business pain points and build solutions to improve the user experience at all levels of the global trade process
Interest in optimizing operational productivity and measuring automation across our software and business processes
A "compliance first" attitude to keep our regulators happy and enthusiastic about Flexport since we operate in a heavily regulated industry.


Worried about not having any logistics experience?

Don’t be! Our mission is to make global trade easy for everyone. That’s why it’s important to bring people from diverse backgrounds and experiences together with our industry veterans to help move the global logistics industry forward.

We know this industry is complex. That’s why we invest in education starting day one with Flexport Academy, a one week intensive onboarding program designed specifically to set every new Flexport employee up for success.

The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range displayed, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education and / or training.

The US base salary range for this position: (exclusive of bonus, equity and benefits.) $89,550 - $107,000 USD

At Flexport, our ability to fulfill our mission of making global commerce easy and accessible relies on having a diverse, dedicated and engaged workforce. That is why Flexport is committed to creating and nurturing an environment where anyone can be their authentic self. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, health status, marital and family status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

per year
Show more

  • Influence the roadmap for both the Data Analytics department and the stakeholders we support

You should have:

  • 2-5 years of experience in a Data Analyst, BI Engineer, Product Analyst, or similar role
  • Strong SQL fluency required – from building entire ERDs of tables containing complex logic to analyzing those datasets into consumable insights for the business.
  • Professional familiarity with applied statistics and scripting languages like Python or R (python preferred)
  • Experience ELT data modeling, especially with dbt (data build tool) is a plus; building analytical narratives using data visualizations (Looker is a plus)
  • Executive communication skills and empathy to understand and discover business pain points and build solutions to improve the user experience at all levels of the global trade process
  • Interest in optimizing operational productivity and measuring automation across our software and business processes
  • A "compliance first" attitude to keep our regulators happy and enthusiastic about Flexport since we operate in a heavily regulated industry.

Worried about not having any logistics experience?

Don’t be! Our mission is to make global trade easy for everyone. That’s why it’s important to bring people from diverse backgrounds and experiences together with our industry veterans to help move the global logistics industry forward.

We know this industry is complex. That’s why we invest in education starting day one with Flexport Academy, a one week intensive onboarding program designed specifically to set every new Flexport employee up for success.

The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range displayed, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education and / or training.

The US base salary range for this position: (exclusive of bonus, equity and benefits.) $89,550 - $107,000 USD

At Flexport, our ability to fulfill our mission of making global commerce easy and accessible relies on having a diverse, dedicated and engaged workforce. That is why Flexport is committed to creating and nurturing an environment where anyone can be their authentic self. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, health status, marital and family status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

per year

Title: Data Analyst, Global Partnerships & Content
Description:
The Global Partnerships & Content organization at Meta works closely with the leading content creators and media entities in the world to build and grow innovative and meaningful content and community engagement experiences across a variety of product areas. The Strategy & Operations team within the Global Partnerships & Content organization seeks a data analyst to support day-to-day analysis and business insights needs. In this role, you will conduct analysis to inform organizational goals, build dashboards and data reporting, and drive deep dive analysis to support the business strategy.

Data Analyst, Global Partnerships & Content Responsibilities:


Develop subject matter expertise in key partner ecosystem metrics across Meta’s Family of Apps.
Deliver regular insights that inform creator and media partnerships strategy.
Build dashboards and reports to track effectiveness and efficiency improvements over time, and guide future decisions.
Establish close working relationships with a variety of cross-functional stakeholders including partner management, data engineering, and product development teams.


Minimum Qualifications:


3+ years of experience querying SQL databases.
3+ years of experience working in an analytical capacity developing insights, defining metrics, and making recommendations.
Presentation and communications experience with extracting insights from technical data sets to varied audiences.
Demonstrated experience thinking strategically about complex issues, leading to thoughtful recommendations and action plans.


Preferred Qualifications:


Management consulting or sales operations background.


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$104,000/year to $146,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Must be a team player with excellent communication and problem-solving skills and have experience working with customers across teams.

Title: Sr Insights Analyst
Description:
Company Description

LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We’re also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that’s built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun – where everyone can succeed.

Join us to transform the way the world works.

Job Description

At LinkedIn, we trust each other to do our best work where it works best for us and our teams. This role offers a hybrid work option, meaning you can both work from home and commute to a LinkedIn office, depending on what’s best for you and when it is important for your team to be together.

As a Sr. Insights Analyst, for LinkedIn Marketing Solutions, you will leverage one of the richest proprietary data sets in the world to discover insights that help our advertising sales team serve our clients and agencies. To be successful in this role you need to be highly analytical, with a strong intellectual curiosity and be comfortable responding to and structuring ambiguous requests. You will also have a passion for  querying databases in SQL or have comparable technical skills. You must be able to juggle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment and work with sales teams to figure out exactly what is impactful to clients. Your stakeholders will not always know what is possible, so it is important that you ask effective questions to get clarity in addition to managing expectations on what you can deliver.

Key responsibilities in this client-facing role include  conducting custom analyses, preparing and delivering client and agency presentations, providing consultative advice to LinkedIn’s top sales reps and responding to client and agency requests. You will become an expert at using coding languages to extract data from LinkedIn’s massive data warehouse and turning that data into compelling stories that help our clients become more successful.

Responsibilities:


Leverage LinkedIn’s unique data to create innovative, custom analyses and tools to address business challenges
Write SQL/Hive/Pig/Python queries to extract necessary data, analyze the results to generate actionable insights and present the findings either in Tableau, Excel or PowerPoint
Understand LinkedIn’s marketing ecosystem and bring new ideas in media analytics and measurement to market that help end-clients make better marketing decisions
Collaborate closely with the sales, marketing, product and insights teams to provide analysis, reporting and tool-building capabilities that inform our key stakeholders
Build cross-functional relationships and partner effectively with other teams for collaborative opportunities
Develop scalable and repeatable playbooks/narratives for internal and external stakeholders
Develop custom analyses to help our clients and prospects better understand the value of LinkedIn data as related to digital marketing
Build deep understanding of customer needs, develop creative solutions relevant to those needs and translate findings from data in a commercially-impactful, executive-friendly way
Serve as a strategic advisor to internal and external stakeholders as it pertains to data usage, insights, and measurement
Travel requirements: approximately 10% of the time for team offsite, LinkedIn conferences, and client meetings.



Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree
5+ years of experience in an analytics or consulting role
Experience analyzing data in SQL, Excel, SAS or other similar software
Experience building visualizations and client-ready reports from data



Preferred Qualifications:


2+ years of experience in a digital marketing analytics
Experience with Tableau
Experience with data analysis and storytelling
Ability to communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences
Excellent interpersonal, communication, writing, presentation, statistical and data analysis skills
Experience with big data technologies like Hadoop
Experience of working with agencies and a familiarity with the media agency landscape
Expert knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint and Excel)



Suggested Skills:


Digital Marketing
Performance Marketing
Data Analysis
Data Storytelling



LinkedIn is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.

The pay range for this role is $102,000 to $160,000. Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, depth of experience, certifications, and specific work location. This may be different in other locations due to differences in the cost of labor.

The total compensation package for this position may also include annual performance bonus, stock, benefits and/or other applicable incentive compensation plans. For more information, visit https://careers.linkedin.com/benefits.

Additional Information

Equal Opportunity Statement

LinkedIn is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. LinkedIn considers qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class. LinkedIn is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer as described in our equal opportunity statement here: EEO Statement_2020 - Signed.pdf.

Please reference the following information for more information: https://legal.linkedin.com/content/dam/legal/LinkedIn_EEO_Statement_2020.pdf.

Please reference the following information for more information: https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2023-06/22-088_EEOC_KnowYourRights6.12ScreenRdr.pdf and

https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf for more information.

LinkedIn is committed to offering an inclusive and accessible experience for all job seekers, including individuals with disabilities. Our goal is to foster an inclusive and accessible workplace where everyone has the opportunity to be successful.

If you need a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening, apply for a position, or participate in the interview process, connect with us at accommodations@linkedin.com and describe the specific accommodation requested for a disability-related limitation.

Reasonable accommodations are modifications or adjustments to the application or hiring process that would enable you to fully participate in that process. Examples of reasonable accommodations include but are not limited to:


Documents in alternate formats or read aloud to you

Having a sign language interpreter present for the interview



A request for an accommodation will be responded to within three business days. However, non-disability related requests, such as following up on an application, will not receive a response.

Title: Customer Insights Analyst
Description:
As a Customer Insights Analyst, you will be responsible for extracting, analyzing, and interpreting customer data to provide actionable insights and support data-driven decision-making processes. The successful candidate will have a background in SQL and Python, with a proven track record of leveraging these technical skills to manipulate large datasets and derive valuable insights. This position will play an important role on the growing Loyalty & Customer Engagement team, focusing on developing a better understanding of our customer and driving more repeat business for Omni.




Responsibilities

Develop and maintain automated data pipelines to streamline data processing and analysis projects into and out of existing and emerging technology.
Responsible for implementation, maintenance and subject-matter expertise on future Customer Data Platform and Customer Loyalty technology.
Support adoption efforts and change management of Customer 360 initiatives cross-functionally.
Conduct comprehensive evaluations of financial and economic impacts related to value proposition changes and promotional strategies for our Omni Select Guests
Create and execute action plans for engaging high-potential Members and minimizing losses from churn.
Generate reports and visualizations to present findings and insights in a clear and actionable manner, oriented around growing revenue and Customer Lifetime Value.
Utilize Python for data cleaning, transformation, and statistical analysis to uncover patterns and trends in customer behavior.
Design and develop SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from various databases and data sources.
Perform ad-hoc analysis as needed to address specific business questions or challenges.




Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field preferred.
1-3 years of professional experience in a data analysis or data engineering role, with a focus on customer data.
Creative problem-solver that enjoys identifying patterns and unlocking new solutions to business challenges.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation from relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and programming skills in Python.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is strongly preferred.
Knowledge of hospitality industry trends, customer behavior, and best practices in the digital marketing landscape is preferred.

This position will play an important role on the growing Loyalty & Customer Engagement team, focusing on developing a better understanding of our customer and driving more repeat business for Omni.


Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain automated data pipelines to streamline data processing and analysis projects into and out of existing and emerging technology.
  • Responsible for implementation, maintenance and subject-matter expertise on future Customer Data Platform and Customer Loyalty technology.
  • Support adoption efforts and change management of Customer 360 initiatives cross-functionally.
  • Conduct comprehensive evaluations of financial and economic impacts related to value proposition changes and promotional strategies for our Omni Select Guests
  • Create and execute action plans for engaging high-potential Members and minimizing losses from churn.
  • Generate reports and visualizations to present findings and insights in a clear and actionable manner, oriented around growing revenue and Customer Lifetime Value.
  • Utilize Python for data cleaning, transformation, and statistical analysis to uncover patterns and trends in customer behavior.
  • Design and develop SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from various databases and data sources.
  • Perform ad-hoc analysis as needed to address specific business questions or challenges.


Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field preferred.
  • 1-3 years of professional experience in a data analysis or data engineering role, with a focus on customer data.
  • Creative problem-solver that enjoys identifying patterns and unlocking new solutions to business challenges.
  • Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation from relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and programming skills in Python.
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is strongly preferred.
  • Knowledge of hospitality industry trends, customer behavior, and best practices in the digital marketing landscape is preferred.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: North Metro Atlanta area (Hybrid)

Reports to: Chief Investment Officer

OVERVIEW:

Flock Financial, LLC is seeking a dynamic Data Analyst to join our analytics and acquisitions teams. This role is pivotal in enhancing efficiency and communication in financing our clients. Through in-house mentoring and hands-on experience, you will develop expertise in underwriting and data analysis within the alternative financing space.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Underwriting & Analytics:

Gain a comprehensive understanding of underwriting in alternative financing through in-house mentoring.
Cleanse and standardize data files to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Evaluate inbound portfolio data, creating detailed account breakdowns using Flock’s proprietary tools.
Analyze data files using statistical tools to create visual representations (tables, histograms, choropleths, box-and-whisker plots).

Financial Analysis:

Navigate and understand financial waterfalls that support deal preparation and performance tracking.
Prepare preliminary cash flow and cost waterfalls for new investments, including scenario analysis at various performance levels.
Upload and manage incoming data within our database system.
Maintain links between Estimated Remaining Net Collections (ERNC) and supporting waterfalls.

Reporting & Compliance:

Support the Accounting and Finance department in preparing and distributing Quarterly
Investor Reports and Annual Reports.
Assist with data extraction for audits, field exams, and compliance reviews.
Develop, maintain, and update Power BI dashboards for senior management and clients.
Identify and investigate data and performance anomalies to enhance investment performance.

Client Data Management:

Utilize in-house AI/ML tools to identify areas for client performance optimization.
Conduct initial reviews of incoming client data files for accuracy and completeness.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Proficiency in Microsoft Office, in particular advanced Excel skills.
Proficiency in statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
Strong understanding of financial concepts and performance metrics.
Experience with database management and data extraction.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a hybrid work environment.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
Familiarity with PowerBI and AI/ML tools is a plus.

BENEFITS:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
Collaborative and supportive work environment.

RELOCATION ASSISTANCE NOT AVAILABLE

Join Flock Financial, LLC and be part of a team that drives innovation and excellence in alternative

financing. Apply today to make a significant impact on our clients and our company’s success.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Key Responsibilities:

Collect, organize, and analyse large sets of data from various sources.
Develop and implement data analyses, data collection systems, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports.
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
Work closely with the ETL / DE team to ensure data integrity, quality and security.
Create visualizations and reports for requested projects.
Perform data mining and analyse data to identify opportunities for improvement.

Qualifications:

Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data flow, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc.), databases (SQL etc.), programming (ETL frameworks or Python).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Prior experience of working with Finance data is good to have.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
eNGINE builds Technical Teams. We are a Solutions and Placement firm shaped by decades of interaction with Technical professionals. Our inspiration is continuous learning and engagement with the markets we serve, the talent we represent, and the teams we build. Our Consulting Workforce is encouraged to enjoy career fulfillment in the form of challenging projects, schedule flexibility, and paid training/certifications. Successful outcomes start and finish with eNGINE.




eNGINE is hiring a Data Reporting Analyst for a client of ours, in the pharmacy space, who will be responsible for assisting a massive reconstruction of a data warehouse. This person will be proficient in SQL, and has the ability to analyze, interpret, and clean data sets.




Job duties:

Develop, deploy, and maintain regular reports.
Define data needs for specific departments and contractual compliance in collaboration with the analytics team.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity verification.
Cleanse and mine data from various sources, ensuring integrity pre-deployment.
Deploy, test, and develop standard and custom reports and analytics for strategic and operational analysis to internal and/or external users.
Interpret, identify, and analyze trends in data sets.




What we're looking for:

2+ years of SQL experience
2+ years of Azure Data Factory and/or Databricks
Ability to analyze massive data sets.
Preferred experience in speciality pharmaceuticals and/or healthcare




No C2C. Reach out to me for more details!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Compensation Team

Hybrid position - will work onsite 2-3 days a week in New York City

Must be elgible for a Top Secret Security Clearance

55.00-60.00 Hourly W2

No Corp to Corp or 3rd party agences.




Required: business intelligence, data analytics, reporting and basic project management
Strong excel skills and working with compensation.







The Data Analyst will be working on a Bank-wide initiative that has taken a tremendous number of hours from the core team to design, set up, and deliver a holistic job review and compensation which follows guldelines to ensure all positions are compensated fairly. This is a collaborative project involving several sponsors. The core team is made up of multiple stakeholders including PMO, Recognition, Organization Effectiveness, and the Internal Communications teams) and Corporate Matters in Legal centered around compensation.




In this position you will

Use a variety of tools and techniques, perform hands-on data analysis to transform, model and visualize structured and unstructured data to prepare it for downstream consumers
Provide support to management and business users who are looking to leverage data and analytical tools and techniques
Effectively plan, prioritize, and manage multiple projects for self and team.
Gain a deep understanding of the business concepts underlying assigned data assets and their associated data models.

Qualifications

Foundational experience in business intelligence, data analytics, reporting and basic project management
Strong excel skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

PCI requires support in data analytics and visualization supporting a large and dynamic Federal procurement organization.

We are looking for a Data Analyst who can support and meet the qualifications below.

Responsibilities

Obtains data through advanced computerized models using a variety of software, including Tableau, PowerBI and Excel.
Extrapolates data patterns through advanced algorithms.
Develops graphs and charts to explain how mathematical information will influence the specific project or business.
Develops, maintains, innovates, and enhances workload tracking visualizations and make recommendations based on industry best practices how to display procurement workload and resource management data to guide the process for assigning working, managing work, managing workload, and identifying risk early on.
Develops and maintains an executive landing page where dashboards for leadership.
Develops dashboards focused on business processes and management levels to guide leadership at all levels in making data driven decisions;
Defines, develops, and documents future measurement framework reporting/visualization;
Defines, develops, and maintains governance plan for maintaining dashboards
Develops and implements a business process for receiving, evaluating, developing, tracking, and maintaining report requests to support reporting needs.
Streamlines activities to maximize efficiencies and reporting.
Develops and maintains a data catalog of available automation, reports, and dashboards to guide transparency and improve customer experience.
Presents to managers how to best alter their business models to generate profitable future trends.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree from an accredited school.
At least (8) years of experience on contracts of similar size or scope with experience in Federal acquisition and contract management.
Must have experience with Excel, Tableau, M365 Power Apps, PowerBi Power Automate, and all elements of Power Platform expertise in utilizing and developing work products that aid in data-driven decision-making.
Proven ability to solve problems creatively.
Strong familiarity with software tools, methodologies, and best practices.
Excellent analytical skills.




PCI Federal Services (PCIFS) and it's subsidiaries is an equal-opportunity employer. PCIFS does not discriminate on the basis of age, sex, race, national origin, religion, marital status, sexual orientation or identity, Veterans or Disability status.

Preference may be extended to qualified Native American Indian candidates

in accordance with applicable federal law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join the Revolution and harness your passion for big data and analytics to drive insights across our business. As our Data Analyst, you will tap into your analytical skills to address a variety of business challenges through both routine and special data analysis. Your role is crucial in transforming raw data into clear and compelling visualizations that provide straightforward insights into complex issues.

Responsibilities

Administer the DOMO platform, including creating user accounts and setting permissions, to ensure data is accessible and secure.
Develop clear visual reports, KPI scorecards, and dashboards using DOMO to illustrate and track key business metrics.
Perform data validation and cleaning to maintain the integrity of our datasets.
Employ analytical thinking to translate complex datasets into informative reports and visuals that clearly convey data-driven insights.
Model data warehouse schema (star-schema) for new datasets to enhance our analytical capabilities.
Modify and update DOMO datasets with new data from various systems like LOS, CRM, and our website to keep information current and relevant.
Connect data sources, import data, and transform data for Business Intelligence to help the company derive new insights from existing datasets.




Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in a related field such as Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or equivalent combination of education and/or experience.
3-5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the mortgage industry.
Proficient in using BI tools and systems, particularly DOMO, Power BI, and Tableau.
Strong customer service skills with the ability to communicate effectively with all levels of management and external stakeholders.
Skilled in identifying the root causes of data anomalies and addressing data quality issues.
Familiarity with basic principles of accounting, finance, mathematics, and statistics.

Show more

Title: Jr. Data Analyst
Description:
We are UMG, the Universal Music Group. We are the world’s leading music company. In everything we do, we are committed to artistry, innovation and entrepreneurship. We own and operate a broad array of businesses engaged in recorded music, music publishing, merchandising, and audiovisual content in more than 60 countries. We identify and develop recording artists and songwriters, and we produce, distribute and promote the most critically acclaimed and commercially successful music to delight and entertain fans around the world.

Universal Music Group Nashville (UMGN) is currently seeking an Junior Data Analyst. This position will work within the Data & Research Team to build practical and creative data engineering solutions to fulfill business requests. This role will work closely with the Dir, Data & Research to provide precise reporting and necessary business tools for Universal Music Group Nashville. The position requires a strong skill set in mining, testing, and analyzing data.

How We LEAD


Own the creation of key data sets that drive existing and future internal reporting tools within Universal Music Group Nashville (UMGN).
Provide practical and creative data engineering solutions on large sets of data.
Support the Data & Research Team on data initiatives, ensuring optimal data delivery for all projects.
Communicate data-driven insights and recommendations within the Data & Research Team.
Liaison with Corporate Data team to stay informed and up to date on latest data and analytic tools available internally and externally.
Other additional duties and responsibilities as needed.


How You'll CREATE


Coding experience with SQL or a similar product suite is required.
Experience extracting data from data lake is required.
A direct background and current position with a heavy use of data analytics.
A passion for data, especially for creating efficient and scalable models
Advanced user of Microsoft Office Suite with heavy Excel work required.
A rabid desire to acquire knowledge from anywhere, whether related parallel industries to highly unlikely sources, and apply it to our situation with constant trial and error.
A relaxed and confident approach to all business relationships internally and externally.
Familiarity with music industry consumption (music streaming partners) is a plus.


Bring Your VIBE


Ideally, 2 years of experience using databases and analytic tools to build business solutions
Undergraduate or technical degree with highly relevant background required.


Perks Playlist


Be part of an entrepreneurial, global organization that values authenticity, drive, creativity, relationships, and a competitive spirit
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and FSA options, as well as:
100% coverage for out-patient mental health services
Wellbeing reimbursements for fitness classes, spa treatments, meal services, travel, and so much more (up to $720/year)
A lifetime fertility support allowance of $30,000 to plan participants
Student Loan Repayment Assistance and Tuition Reimbursement
100% immediately vested 401(k) match on the first 5% of your contribution on eligible compensation


Variety of ways to prioritize much-needed time away from work including:
Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) for exempt employees
3-weeks PTO for non-exempt employees
2-weeks paid Winter Break
10 Company Holidays (including Juneteenth and Wellbeing Day)
Summer Fridays (between Memorial Day and Labor Day)
Generous paid parental leave for every type of parent

Check out our full overview of benefits on the Perks Playlist page of the career site.

Disclaimer: This job description only provides an overview of job responsibilities that are subject to change.

Universal Music Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer

We are an E-Verify employer in Alabama, Arizona, Georgia, Mississippi, North Carolina, South Carolina, Tennessee, and Utah.

For more information, please click on the following links.

E-Verify Participation Poster: English / Spanish

E-Verify Right to Work Poster: English | Spanish

Job Category

Data, Analytics & Business Intelligence

Salary Range

$48,230 - $55,120

The actual base salary offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include, as applicable, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, specific and unique skills, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job. All candidates are encouraged to apply.

Universal Music Group Nashville (UMGN) is currently seeking an Junior Data Analyst. This position will work within the Data & Research Team to build practical and creative data engineering solutions to fulfill business requests. This role will work closely with the Dir, Data & Research to provide precise reporting and necessary business tools for Universal Music Group Nashville. The position requires a strong skill set in mining, testing, and analyzing data.

How We LEAD

  • Own the creation of key data sets that drive existing and future internal reporting tools within Universal Music Group Nashville (UMGN).
  • Provide practical and creative data engineering solutions on large sets of data.
  • Support the Data & Research Team on data initiatives, ensuring optimal data delivery for all projects.
  • Communicate data-driven insights and recommendations within the Data & Research Team.
  • Liaison with Corporate Data team to stay informed and up to date on latest data and analytic tools available internally and externally.
  • Other additional duties and responsibilities as needed.

How You'll CREATE

  • Coding experience with SQL or a similar product suite is required.
  • Experience extracting data from data lake is required.
  • A direct background and current position with a heavy use of data analytics.
  • A passion for data, especially for creating efficient and scalable models
  • Advanced user of Microsoft Office Suite with heavy Excel work required.
  • A rabid desire to acquire knowledge from anywhere, whether related parallel industries to highly unlikely sources, and apply it to our situation with constant trial and error.
  • A relaxed and confident approach to all business relationships internally and externally.
  • Familiarity with music industry consumption (music streaming partners) is a plus.

Bring Your VIBE

  • Ideally, 2 years of experience using databases and analytic tools to build business solutions
  • Undergraduate or technical degree with highly relevant background required.

Perks Playlist

  • Be part of an entrepreneurial, global organization that values authenticity, drive, creativity, relationships, and a competitive spirit
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and FSA options, as well as:
    • 100% coverage for out-patient mental health services
    • Wellbeing reimbursements for fitness classes, spa treatments, meal services, travel, and so much more (up to $720/year)
    • A lifetime fertility support allowance of $30,000 to plan participants
    • Student Loan Repayment Assistance and Tuition Reimbursement
    • 100% immediately vested 401(k) match on the first 5% of your contribution on eligible compensation

  • Variety of ways to prioritize much-needed time away from work including:
    • Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) for exempt employees
    • 3-weeks PTO for non-exempt employees
    • 2-weeks paid Winter Break
    • 10 Company Holidays (including Juneteenth and Wellbeing Day)
    • Summer Fridays (between Memorial Day and Labor Day)
    • Generous paid parental leave for every type of parent
Check out our full overview of benefits on the Perks Playlist page of the career site.

Disclaimer: This job description only provides an overview of job responsibilities that are subject to change.

Universal Music Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer

We are an E-Verify employer in Alabama, Arizona, Georgia, Mississippi, North Carolina, South Carolina, Tennessee, and Utah.

For more information, please click on the following links.

E-Verify Participation Poster: English / Spanish

E-Verify Right to Work Poster: English | Spanish

Job Category

Data, Analytics & Business Intelligence

Salary Range

$48,230 - $55,120

The actual base salary offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include, as applicable, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, specific and unique skills, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job. All candidates are encouraged to apply.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

We are looking for a driven, early career individual, with a passion for analytics and innovation to join us in turning the largest cardiovascular database in the US into meaningful and impactful insights. As an Associate Data Analyst, your success will be measured by the quality and actionable nature of our analytics deliverables to hospital customers. Your contributions will have the ability to save real patients’ lives and propel egnite to the next state of evolution.




The ideal candidate has at least 2 years of experience in an analytics role, has an eye for detail, and a quantitative and creative mindset. This individual will bring strong communication, strong work ethic, and team-player attitude to help tackle any task, executing on the nuts and bolts of our ‘get it done’ culture. The candidate should know SQL and be prepared to rapidly acquire new analytical and technical skills on the job including Kaplan Meir analysis and data manipulation using python in a big data environment (Databricks).




Duties and Responsibilities:




Strategic thinking to generate impactful insights that benefit patients and hospitals
Development of new analyses using python and SQL and presenting those results internally via PowerPoint Presentation
Clear communication of data to our customer reporting team, ensuring they're equipped with the necessary detail to support groundbreaking insights in customer meetings
Analyze large data sets to identify trends and patterns
Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Stay up-to-date with new data analysis techniques and tools
Assist in data cleaning, preprocessing, and data wrangling
Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify key variables and insights




This role requires privileged access controls for critical systems or data, ensuring that only authorized employees have access to sensitive information to help prevent data breaches and unauthorized access to sensitive information.




Education and experience:

A bachelor’s degree in a business or quantitative field – Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Biology, Finance, or related field.
At least 2 years of experience in a data analytics role
Experience with SQL and databases required
A talent for data driven story-telling and executive message development
PowerBi, Databricks, pyspark, and/or R, preferred
A passion for making a difference in the world – in our case, helping patients
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Natural curiosity, eagerness to learning, and willing to self-study to gain expertise in cardiovascular clinical and hospital administration topics
Team player excited by the prospect of shared successes in collaboration with our clinical client success team and hospital customers
Strong attention to detail and organization skills
Comfortable with statistical concepts
Location flexibility within the United States, with occasional travel (up to 5%) to our headquarters in Orange County or to support customer presentations
Work authorization in the United States




egnite is a rapidly growing digital healthcare company dedicated to improving care for heart disease patients. Our vision is to create an evolved healthcare landscape in which data, technology, patients, and clinical expertise are at the intersection of healthcare transformation - simply put, we want to improve the care for every heart patient across the US.




At egnite, we take security seriously, and it plays a role in all jobs within our organization. We believe that every employee has a responsibility to help maintain a secure and safe work environment, protect our company’s assets and reputation, and safeguard our customers’ data and privacy. Therefore, all employees are expected to comply with our security policies and procedures, and to report any security incidents or concerns promptly.




Please note that some positions may require additional security clearances or certifications, depending on the nature of the job and the level of access to sensitive information. If such requirements exist, they will be clearly stated in the job description, and all applicants will be expected to meet these requirements as a condition of employment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Como nuestro próximo Data Analyst desempeñarás un papel crucial dentro del equipo de Content Strategy and Analysis, contribuyendo a la generación de insights que guiarán las decisiones estratégicas de la empresa. Esta posición es fundamental para analizar las tendencias de la industria musical y el performance de nuestros artistas en las diversas plataformas digitales.

 

Principales responsabilidades:




Análisis de datos para extraer insights que respalden decisiones estratégicas.
Identificar tendencias emergentes y oportunidades de crecimiento dentro del repertorio musical de Sony Music.
Monitorear y analizar el desempeño de nuestros artistas en plataformas digitales como Spotify, TikTok, Apple Music, Amazon Music, YouTube, etc.
Evaluar la efectividad de las campañas de marketing digital, integrando métricas de publicidad con patrones de consumo.
Desarrollar presentaciones y visualizaciones impactantes para comunicar insights complejos de manera efectiva y comprensible.
Comunicarse estrechamente con los equipos de Marketing y A&R en la recopilación y aplicación de insights.




Requisitos:

Título universitario en Ingeniería Industrial, Ciencia de Datos, Análisis de Negocios, un campo relacionado, o experiencia práctica equivalente.
Experiencia mínima de uno a dos años en análisis de datos.
Inglés avanzado

(Indispensable)

Dominio avanzado de Microsoft Excel
Buen dominio de SQL
Lenguaje de programación: Python
Herramientas de visualización de datos como Tableau, Power BI
Microsoft Office: PowerPoint avanzado




Cualidades:

Pasión profunda por la música
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita
Capacidad para comunicar ideas técnicas a audiencias no técnicas
Proactividad y trabajo en equipo
Fuertes habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas.
Sólida capacidad de visualización de datos.
Curioso y automotivado.




Ofrecemos:

Contrato directo con Sony Music México
Salario competitivo y paquete de beneficios atractivo
Prestaciones superiores de ley (Fondo de ahorro, vales de despensa, Gastos médicos mayores, Seguro de vida, Bono de productividad)




¡Únete a nosotros y conviértete en parte de un equipo innovador!

Title: Excel Data Analyst
Description:
Duration: 6+ months

Compensation: up to $35-45/hr (W2 only!)

Location: 5 days/week in Brooklyn, NY


U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time. ***


Responsibilities/Requirements


Must be the Excel SME where you will be primarily responsible for running analytics on a large scale inventory management project.
Must be very well versed on Excel macros and formulas and how to manage large files with multiple data points.
Should have some SharePoint experience.
Excellent communication and organization skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Ability to work standard business hours, on-site, 5 days per week.

Title: Data Analyst, Core Systems
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
1 year of experience in technical troubleshooting and writing code in one or more programming languages.
Experience in technical project management, stakeholder management, professional services, solution engineering, or technical consulting.
Experience with SQL, Data Analysis, Data Analytics, Dashboards, and ETL Tools.


Preferred qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (Business, Math/Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or similar).
1 year of experience in data analysis or a related field.
Experience working with large and complex datasets. Demonstrated experience in using SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis.
Experience in building and maintaining data pipelines using tools like Apache Airflow or similar.
Experience working with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into actionable insights.
Proficiency in any one of the data visualization tool (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Data Studio).


About The Job

As a Technical Solutions Consultant, you will be responsible for the technical relationship of our largest advertising clients and/or product partners. You will lead cross-functional teams in Engineering, Sales and Product Management to leverage emerging technologies for our external clients/partners. From concept design and testing to data analysis and support, you will oversee the technical execution and business operations of Google's online advertising platforms and/or product partnerships.

You will be able to balance business and partner needs with technical constraints, develop innovative, cutting edge solutions and act as a partner and consultant to those you are working with. You will also be able to build tools and automate products, oversee the technical execution and business operations of Google's partnerships, as well as develop product strategy and prioritize projects and resources.

The Core team builds the technical foundation behind Google’s flagship products. We are owners and advocates for the underlying design elements, developer platforms, product components, and infrastructure at Google. These are the essential building blocks for excellent, safe, and coherent experiences for our users and drive the pace of innovation for every developer. We look across Google’s products to build central solutions, break down technical barriers and strengthen existing systems. As the Core team, we have a mandate and a unique opportunity to impact important technical decisions across the company.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $94,500-$139,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.

Responsibilities


Develop and execute complex SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data from various sources. Design and build interactive dashboards that effectively communicate key insights and trends to stakeholders.
Craft data-driven narratives that guide users through dashboards, uncovering meaningful insights and actionable recommendations through user-centric experiences.
Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines to collect, process, and integrate data from disparate sources.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity throughout the pipeline, implementing validation and error-handling procedures. Automate data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes to improve efficiency and reduce manual effort.
Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including product managers, engineers, and business leaders, to gather requirements, prioritize projects, and deliver actionable insights.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Predictive Data Analyst
Description:
Position Description

The Predictive Data Analyst will support stakeholders by defining data needs and ensuring data science projects meet business objectives across various levels. The role involves using statistical programming languages and tools for data manipulation, analysis, and visualization, including end-to-end predictive modeling from exploratory analysis to deployment and results interpretation.

Key Tasks


Managing data through querying, cleaning, merging, quality control, regular reporting, special project deliverables, and documentation.
Collaboration with IT staff to develop data pipelines, design and maintain reports and dashboards, and work with program staff to ensure analyses lead to actionable insights for decision-making and program improvement.
Strong background in predictive analytics and tool development is essential.
Customer experience working directly with a client-centric relational database and managing individuals.
Strong technical knowledge and comfortable doing analyses and building reports from an SQL database.
The analyst should be comfortable with various analytical tools and have taken the lead on projects where the best path forward is unclear. Customer service mindset.


Experience Required


4 years of experience with responsibility for planning, designing, conducting, and evaluating research projects involving the application of techniques of machine learning, predictive analytics, data management, and hypothesis-driven data analysis to complex experimental designs, leading to actionable findings and recommendations.


Education Required

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in a field of applied research such as Data Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Analytics, Psychology, or Public Health that includes 12 semester or 18 quarter units of coursework in data science, predictive analytics, quantitative research methods, or statistical analysis.

Trinus Corporation, a leading provider of technology solutions and services with over 25 years of experience, is a certified WBE/MBE/SBE/SDB firm accredited by WBENC, NMSDC, and SBA.

Our mission is to shape the future of work by aligning the right mix of people, process, technology, and innovation to efficiently meet our clients' business objectives.

At Trinus, we understand that finding the right opportunity is pivotal in your career journey. Our staffing services go beyond mere placements; they are about matching your skills and aspirations with the perfect fit.

To learn more about us, please visit our website www.trinus.com

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Mark Cuban Cost Plus Drug Company, PBC
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will be a key contributor to our mission of making affordable medications accessible to everyone. You will use your analytical skills and expertise to uncover valuable insights from complex datasets. These insights will directly guide our strategies, help us measure the impact of our initiatives, and ultimately improve patient affordability. This role is ideal for someone with a strong analytical mindset, technical skills, and the ability to translate complex data into clear recommendations.




DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Data Cleaning and Preparation:

Collect, clean, and organize data from diverse sources.
Ensure data accuracy and completeness through validation.
Learn and apply data cleaning techniques to prepare data for analysis.




Data Analysis and Insights:

Assist in conducting analyses to identify trends, patterns, and key insights.
Support the creation of reports, dashboards, and visualizations that effectively communicate findings.
Translate complex data findings into actionable recommendations for stakeholders.




Data Quality:

Help identify and resolve data quality issues and discrepancies.
Learn about data quality standards and best practices in the healthcare industry.




Cross-Functional Collaboration:

Partner with various business units to support their data needs, including ad-hoc analysis and report generation.
Adapt your approach to meet the specific requirements of different teams.




Continuous Learning and Growth:

Actively participate in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and System Testing to ensure data accuracy and system functionality.
Embrace opportunities to learn new skills and tools as our data landscape evolves.




EDUCATION AND/OR TRAINING:

Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.




WORK EXPERIENCE:

2+ years of experience in data analysis (healthcare or pharmaceutical experience is a plus).
Equivalent combination of education and industry experience will be considered.
“Power user” of Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets
Demonstrated ability to conduct ad hoc analyses under tight deadlines
Familiarity with SQL and data manipulation tools (Python or R is preferred)




ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:

Ability to work independently with little to no supervision.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Passion for using data to answer questions and drive decisions
Meticulous attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Enthusiasm for our mission of affordable medication access

  • Assist in conducting analyses to identify trends, patterns, and key insights.
  • Support the creation of reports, dashboards, and visualizations that effectively communicate findings.
  • Translate complex data findings into actionable recommendations for stakeholders.


Data Quality:

  • Help identify and resolve data quality issues and discrepancies.
  • Learn about data quality standards and best practices in the healthcare industry.


Cross-Functional Collaboration:

  • Partner with various business units to support their data needs, including ad-hoc analysis and report generation.
  • Adapt your approach to meet the specific requirements of different teams.


Continuous Learning and Growth:

  • Actively participate in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and System Testing to ensure data accuracy and system functionality.
  • Embrace opportunities to learn new skills and tools as our data landscape evolves.


EDUCATION AND/OR TRAINING:

  • Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.


WORK EXPERIENCE:

  • 2+ years of experience in data analysis (healthcare or pharmaceutical experience is a plus).
  • Equivalent combination of education and industry experience will be considered.
  • “Power user” of Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets
  • Demonstrated ability to conduct ad hoc analyses under tight deadlines
  • Familiarity with SQL and data manipulation tools (Python or R is preferred)


ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Ability to work independently with little to no supervision.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Passion for using data to answer questions and drive decisions
  • Meticulous attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Enthusiasm for our mission of affordable medication access

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

PCS Global Tech Poway, California, United States (Hybrid)

Save

Apply

Position Overview:

We are excited to welcome a motivated Entry-Level Data Analyst to our team. This role is perfect for individuals who are passionate about diving into data, extracting valuable insights, and helping drive data-driven decision-making within our organization. As an Entry-Level Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to learn and contribute to our data analysis efforts, working closely with experienced professionals to support informed business choices.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis:

Collaborate with various departments to gather data requirements and perform data analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and anomalies.

Assist in data cleansing and transformation to ensure accurate and reliable data for reporting.

Data Visualization:

Work with the team to design compelling visualizations that provide clear insights into key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics.

Assist in creating interactive dashboards and reports that make complex data easily understandable.

Data Reporting:

Contribute to the development and maintenance of data reports, ensuring they align with business needs.

Assist in optimizing data reporting processes to enhance efficiency.

Collaboration:

Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and assist in creating solutions that address business needs.

Participate in discussions to gather feedback and refine data analysis and reporting based on user input.

Quality Assurance:

Assist in validating the accuracy of data used in analysis and reporting.

Perform thorough testing to ensure the functionality and reliability of data solutions.

Learning and Growth:

Stay updated on the latest data analysis tools, best practices, and industry trends.

Proactively seek opportunities to enhance technical skills and contribute to the team's success.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Business Analytics, Computer Science, or Information Systems.

Basic understanding of data analysis concepts and principles.

Familiarity with data analysis tools is a plus, but not required.

Strong analytical skills and a passion for transforming data into actionable insights.

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

Enthusiasm for learning and a proactive attitude toward professional development.

Ability to work collaboratively within a team and adapt to changing priorities.

Join our team as an Entry-Level Data Analyst and gain hands-on experience in extracting valuable insights from data to drive our business forward. Be part of a dynamic environment where you'll contribute to data-driven decision-making and make a meaningful impact.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Position Summary

Founded in 2005, Value Partners Investments (VPI) is a Winnipeg-based investment firm that currently manages over $4.7 Billion in assets primarily through nine investment funds as well as through Value Partners Investment Counsel (VPIC) which provides discretionary investment management services to wealthy families across Canada.

Our mission is to build client wealth by investing wisely and communicating clearly. Over the past 18 years we have fulfilled that mission by creating over $1.8 Billion in investment gains for clients. This track record of success has enabled us to become one of Canada’s fastest growing companies as ranked by Profit Magazine and one of Canada’s fastest growing Private Investment Counsels by Investor Economics.

Reporting to the Director of Information Technology, the Data Analyst plays a crucial role in transforming raw data into actionable insights for our organization. Your work will empower decision-makers by providing clear visualizations and reports. You will collaborate with various stakeholders to bridge the gap between technical and non-technical teams.

The Data Analyst is a key member of the IT team who collaborates daily with various internal stakeholders of the business while understanding our products and services within the financial services industry and VPI’s place in it. Internally to VPI this also means living VPI’s investment philosophy, our products, our values and supporting our strategic direction.

, Job Description

Key Responsibilities:


Collaboration: Work closely with business teams to understand requirements and translate them into meaningful visualizations.
Metric Definition: Lead the process to define and document the definitions of key metrics required by stakeholders.
Data Analysis: Analyze data, identify trends, and uncover patterns to drive informed business decisions.
Power BI Development: Leverage Microsoft’s Power BI to create interactive dashboards and reports.
Data Modeling: Work with the Senior Data Architect to design and develop data models that effectively support business requirements.
Accuracy and Reliability: Ensure the accuracy and reliability of data presented in dashboards and reports.
Effective Communication: Clearly convey complex data insights to stakeholders.
Power BI Adoption: Train and support staff on the use of Power BI
Business Intelligence: Contribute to the organization’s data-driven strategy built on Microsoft Fabric.
Other miscellaneous duties and special projects as assigned.


, Qualifications

Education & Experience:


Diploma or degree in a related field.
A minimum of 2-3 years working with diverse BI tools, with expertise in Microsoft Power BI. Experience with other components of Microsoft Fabric considered an asset.
A combination of education and experience will be considered.


Technical Skills:


SQL, Nice -To-Have: Proficiency in programming languages such as R and Python.
Strong knowledge of DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and M (Power Query) scripting languages.
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI).


Skills & Abilities:


Excellent time management and adaptability.
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to manage multiple tasks.
Proven analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills


Additional Information

Comprehensive health, dental and vision benefits

Health & Wellness Spending Account

4% Matching RRSP allocation

Great workplace culture!
