Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your work days are brighter here.

At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.

About The Team

***APPLICANTS RESIDING OUTSIDE OF THE ATLANTA METRO OR SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED AT THIS TIME***

Join our team and experience Workday!

It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At Workday, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to have a good time, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is fun.

About Analytics At Workday

The Analytics Platform at Workday offers substantial benefits through advanced tools such as Core Reporting, Prism Analytics, Accounting Center, and People Analytics. These tools enable seamless integration, transformation, and analysis of data from diverse sources, ensuring accurate and insightful reporting. By using robust financial and people analytics capabilities, organizations can enhance operational efficiency, ensure compliance with regulations, and gain real-time insights into essential business metrics. This data-driven approach supports informed decision-making and drives critical initiatives, ultimately optimizing business performance and fostering innovation across the organization.

About The Role

Job Description

Workday is seeking an Analytics Analyst to join our Report Performance and Analytics organization, focusing on optimizing configurations, fixing performance issues, and refining customer designs for reports and integrations. We need a candidate passionate about driving performance improvements through meticulous analysis of log and application data. Your role ensures our Prism Analytics, integrated with other Workday analytics applications, delivers robust data insights for confident decision-making and accurate financial reporting. Your expertise in business intelligence, along with good communication and customer handling skills, will be essential for enhancing customer success and overall experience. Join us in shaping impactful data-driven strategies at Workday.

Key Areas of Responsibility:


Develop technical expertise in various Workday technologies, such as the reporting and analytics framework.
Solve issues in customer environments, analyze logs, investigate root causes, and collaborate with colleagues to address bugs.
Provide dedicated support to key accounts for both new and legacy Workday data analytics and reporting products.
Implement performance methodologies to resolve inefficiencies in reports, integrations, and custom configurations.
Collaborate with clients to define technical requirements, translate business needs into efficient reports and configurations, and ensure alignment to standard processes.
Track and prioritize performance improvement opportunities across Support, Operations, Product Management, and Development teams.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends and patterns.
Identify process gaps and collaborate with multi-functional teams to enhance system performance and reliability.
Understand sophisticated analytics use cases, assist customers in issue identification, provide workarounds, and collaborate internally for swift resolution.
Gain deep insights into customer use cases to deliver experienced solutions and support as required.


About You

Basic Qualifications:


2+ years of experience providing enterprise-level support in data analysis, system performance, or related roles
2+ years experience with Financial Reporting
Familiarity with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop ecosystems (HDFS, MapReduce, Hive, Spark)
Intermediate to advanced ability to read and write SQL queries
Ability to communicate data in actionable formats for various audiences, including functional end-users and executive collaborators.


Other Qualifications:


Excellent analytical skills with a proven ability to collect, organize, and analyze large volumes of data to drive product improvement initiatives.
Exceptional interpersonal skills for managing and raising customer escalations.
Effective teamwork skills, both verbal and written, with a track record of working across teams to resolve issues efficiently.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or Mathematics


Workday Pay Transparency Statement

The annualized base salary ranges for the primary location and any additional locations are listed below. Workday pay ranges vary based on work location. As a part of the total compensation package, this role may be eligible for the Workday Bonus Plan or a role-specific commission/bonus, as well as annual refresh stock grants. Recruiters can share more detail during the hiring process. Each candidate’s compensation offer will be based on multiple factors including, but not limited to, geography, experience, skills, job duties, and business need, among other things. For more information regarding Workday’s comprehensive benefits, please click here.

Primary Location: USA.CA.Pleasanton

Primary Location Base Pay Range: $114,700 USD - $172,100 USD

Additional US Location(s) Base Pay Range: $97,400 USD - $172,100 USD

Our Approach to Flexible Work

With Flex Work, we’re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.

Pursuant to applicable Fair Chance law, Workday will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Workday is an Equal Opportunity Employer including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.

Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!

,

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Financial and Data Analyst/Associate

Location: Birmingham, AL




Job Summary:

We seek an exceptionally intelligent, highly motivated Financial and Data Analyst/Associate to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Economics, Data, Engineering, Finance, or Accounting, with exceptional data analysis, database management, and Excel skills. This role requires a detail-oriented individual who can build complex pro forma financial statements and provide insightful data analysis to support strategic decision-making.




Key Responsibilities:

- Data Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights and support business decisions.

- Financial Modeling: Develop and maintain detailed financial models and pro formas to forecast company performance and support strategic planning.

- Database Management: Design, implement, and manage databases to ensure efficient data storage, retrieval, and reporting.

- Excel Mastery: Utilize advanced Excel functions and tools to analyze data, create complex financial models, and automate repetitive tasks.

- Reporting: Prepare comprehensive reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.

- Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including finance, operations, and executive leadership, to understand data needs and deliver high-quality analytical support.

- Process Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement solutions to enhance efficiency and accuracy in data analysis and reporting.

- Market Research: Conduct market research to identify trends, competitive analysis, and business opportunities.

- Ad Hoc Analysis: Perform ad hoc analysis and special projects as needed to support various business initiatives.




Qualifications:

-Education: Bachelor's degree in Economics, Data Science, Engineering, Finance, Accounting, or a related field.

- Experience: Proven experience in data analysis, financial modeling, and database management.

- Technical Skills:

- Proficient in advanced Excel (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, macros, etc.)

- Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)

- Knowledge of database management systems (e.g., SQL, Access)

- Familiarity with financial modeling and pro forma creation

- Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.

- Attention to Detail: High accuracy and attention to detail in all tasks.

- Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present data clearly and concisely.

- Work Ethic: Demonstrated ability to work hard, meet deadlines, and thrive in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.

- Intelligence: Exceptional intellectual capability and the ability to learn and adapt quickly.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Supply Chain Data Expert







Work with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven strategies and measure their effectiveness.
Conduct detailed data analysis on various aspects of the supply chain including procurement, logistics, inventory management, and distribution strategies.
Translate complex data findings into understandable, actionable conceptual data products for supply chain optimization.
Work with Data team to Develop, refine, and maintain data models and simulations for demand forecasting and supply planning.
Conduct detailed data analysis on various aspects of the supply chain including procurement, logistics, inventory management, and distribution strategies, translating complex findings into actionable insights.
Collaborate with a team of Business Intelligence Analysts to design and standardize executive dashboards, ensuring continuous delivery of real-time insights into supply chain metrics and performance indicators.
Work closely with the Data Engineering team to formalize data into enterprise models, optimizing data flow and accessibility for efficient downstream consumption.
Engage with business stakeholders to align the data warehouse with strategic goals, understanding their needs and ensuring the analytics infrastructure addresses relevant business questions.
Prepare and present reports to management on supply chain performance metrics and identify opportunities for improvement.

  • Work with Data team to Develop, refine, and maintain data models and simulations for demand forecasting and supply planning.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analyst

Location: Irving, TX (Onsite)

Duration: FTE

10+ Years of Experience.

Job Description:

Key Skills: ETL, SQL, Data warehouse, Data Analyst
Hands-on experience on Data Analyst role preferable with BFSI domain
ETL, Power BI, SAS, SQL, Tableau, Excel Pivot or some sort of analytical tool reporting experience is good to have

Responsibilities:

Provide analytical perspectives to the business throughout the SDLC process
Analyze and test effort for complex projects spanning multiple business to technology areas
Understand the current data processing and management across various operational processes
Work on the data issues identified for Business and Technology processes as part of the DCRM work.
Consolidation of existing artifacts like Data Models, metadata, DQ practices, Mast & Ref data use cases, Lineage, issues, etc. across each data flow cluster.
Determine and document gaps in the above artifacts.
Identify gaps in the data assets. Create a remediation plan to bridge the gap.
Analyze the data services used in the various application services. Analyze data elements within the data services.
Assist in root cause analysis for the issues identified. Determine and document gaps in these artifacts.
Act as liaison between business function stakeholders and technology teams to elicit, analyze, document, communicate and validate.

Position: Data Analyst

Location: Irving, TX (Onsite)

10+ Years of Experience.

  • Hands-on experience on Data Analyst role preferable with BFSI domain

Title: PowerBI Data Analyst
Description:
Description:

One of Insight Global’s Financial Services clients is looking for an innovative Data Analytics Developer who has a knack for seeing solutions in sprawling data sets across loan and deposit products, building consistent business user experiences, and performing detailed analysis to produce genuine business insights that will find and fuel strategic opportunities. You will work directly with the line of business leaders – including Business Chief Information and Chief Financial Officers – to assess and interpret their reporting needs. You will identify and design reporting solutions based on their requirements. You will use various data query and visualization tools (SQL, Power BI, SAS, etc.) to access multiple data sources and design insightful products for our business partners. You will develop solutions that will have a real impact for the bank and for our customers by building, developing, and maintaining data models, dashboards, reports, data automation systems, and performance metrics support that support key business decisions




Requirements:

Ability and willingness to work onsite 5 days per week (Monday - Friday); no remote flexibility
1+ years of experience working in the Banking/Finanical Services industry
3+ years of experience in developing analytical reports and dashboards using PowerBI
3+ years of experience programming with querying languages: SQL, SAS, R, Python (SQL is a must-have)




If you are looking for an on-site position and have the above requirements, please apply! We look forward to connecting with you.




Compensation:

$45/hour to $65/hour




Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including skills, experience, and education.




Benefit packages for this role will start on the 31st day of employment and include medical, dental, and vision insurance, as well as HSA, FSA, and DCFSA account options, and 401k retirement account access with employer matching. Employees in this role are also entitled to paid sick leave and/or other paid time off as provided by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client that is seeking a Data Analyst in Juno Beach, FL. Overview: The Data Analyst serves as a critical member of data integrity team within digital solutions group and supplies detailed analysis on key data elements that flow between systems to help design governance and master data management strategies and ensure data cleanliness.

Requirements


Significant data analysis/data integrity/data governance skills and proficiency/expertise in analytical tools including Power BI development, Python, coding, Excel, SQL, SOQL, Jira, and others
Must be detail oriented, focused on excellent quality deliverables and able to analyze data quickly using multiple tools and strategies including creating advanced algorithms


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Customer Insights Analyst
Description:
About Us

AliExpress is part of Alibaba International Digital Commerce Group. Launched in 2010, AliExpress is an international marketplace enabling global consumers to buy directly from manufacturers and distributors in China and around the world. It is available in 18 languages, including English, Portuguese, Spanish and French.







Why Join Us

AliExpress elevates shopping with quality products and superior service, streamlining global commerce for SMEs. Imagine a career where your growth is limitless, collaborating on transformative projects with global impact.

AliExpress boasts a global team that spans various countries including China, Spain, the United States, Korea, Saudi Arabia, Brazil, among others. Wherever you are, you'll find AliExpress's spirit of innovation and collaboration.







What We Look For

At AliExpress, we seek passionate, dedicated individuals who thrive in collaborative and innovative environments. Ideal candidates are enthusiastic team players committed to learning and contributing. We value both strategic thinking and proactive execution. Join us, and let's explore limitless possibilities together.







Job Description

1. Explore the local consumption trends and user behavior in the U.S., provide strategic support and insights for local strategy and merchandise planning by combining data and analysis, promoting the planning and execution.

2.Conduct research on consumer portrait and purchasing behaviour in the US market. Propose suggesstions for business development based on analysis results. Collaborate with business teams to optimise governance process mechanisms (risk definition, recall, identification, disposal and other governance processes).

3.Analyse the retail business market (industry, competitors, products, etc.) and provide data analysis results and business improvement recommendations which can enhance the business.

4.Use qualitative and quantitative research methodology and tools to get in-depth insights into users' unsatisfied needs and pain points; Conduct in-depth analysis and research on market development trends and competitors' strategies; Propose executable product strategies, detailed product definitions, or marketing positioning plans.




Qualification

1. Familiar with user research and market insight work, with more than 5 years of cross-border e-commerce user research and market insight related experience;

2. Experience in strategy consulting/internet industry analysis is a plus, Good skills (including but not limited to data analysis, PPT) are required;

3. Structured thinking and analysis ability, good at expression and communication;

4. Excellent execution, driving force, communication skills and spirit of cooperation, able to maintain good communication and collaboration with various teams.

5. Having US or overseas study and e-commerce working experience background is preferred, fluent in English and Chinese.







AliExpress is an equal-opportunity employer. We firmly believe in and practice non-discrimination and inclusion. We welcome and respect individuals from different backgrounds, cultures, communities, and perspectives. Our diverse workforce is a testament to our commitment to equality, ensuring that everyone has an equal opportunity to succeed and contribute.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

FLSA Status: Non-Exempt

Reports to: Director of IT




We are a mission-driven law firm dedicated to assisting Americans in overcoming financial challenges. Our inhouse IT team plays a critical role in all aspects of our daily work including streamlining our workflow and enhancing operational efficiency.




We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst who has great working knowledge with SQL and data visualization to join our team. It is imperative that this person is comfortable and well versed in working collaboratively and cross functionally with other departments. The IT team supports all functions of the business, communication skills are paramount.




You will be responsible for managing data, generating reports, and providing valuable insights to support decision-making across the organization. This position requires strong technical expertise in SQL, attention to detail, problem-solving abilities, relationship building and a commitment to our mission and values.




Key Responsibilities:

Data Management and Analysis:

Utilize SQL and other relevant tools to extract, build, manipulate, and analyze data from various sources.
Develop and maintain data models, databases, and data warehouses to support reporting and analysis.
Identify and address data quality issues, ensuring accuracy and integrity of data.




Reporting and Insights:

Design and generate reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate key metrics and insights.
Analyze data trends, patterns, and anomalies to identify opportunities for improvement and optimization.
Provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis to support strategic decision-making.




Cross-Functional Collaboration:

Collaborate with other teams, departments & the C-suite and to understand data requirements and business needs.
Work closely with the executive team to provide data-driven insights and support organizational goals.
Partner with IT colleagues to integrate data solutions and systems across the organization.




Problem Solving and Error Identification:

Proactively identify and address data discrepancies, errors, and issues.
Troubleshoot technical problems related to data extraction, transformation, and reporting.
Develop and implement solutions to enhance data accuracy, efficiency, and usability.




Mission Alignment and Attitude:

Embrace and uphold the mission and values of the law firm, demonstrating a genuine commitment to helping individuals achieve financial freedom.
Maintain a positive and collaborative attitude while working with cross-functional teams.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders to understand their needs and deliver high-quality solutions.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or a related field.
Strong working knowledge of SQL and experience with database management systems required (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL). Other languages helpful, however SQL is prominent.
Proficiency in reporting tools.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with team members and superiors.
Experience working in a mission-driven organization or a passion for serving others is preferred.




Join our dynamic and mission-focused team, where you'll have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact while utilizing your technical expertise and analytical skills. We work on-site in our Financial District office Monday-Thursday and remotely on Fridays. If you're ready to contribute to our mission of helping Americans get out of debt, we encourage you to apply!




Compensation: Starting salary range of $50,000 – $65,000 depending on relevant experience. We hold bi-annual performance reviews to ensure we are actively identifying top performers, providing formal feedback and assessing merit increases.




How to Apply: To apply for this position, please submit your resume and a member of our team will reach out to you. We appreciate all applications, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.




EEO Compliance: Consumer Legal Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST

New York, US

Your Story:

We are seeking a sharp and highly analytical Data Analyst to join our dynamic and fast-growing company. As a key member of our data team, you will play a crucial role in driving data-driven decisions for optimizing performance across our organization. You'll collaborate closely with various departments, providing valuable insights that enable our business operations to focus effectively and steer the company in the right direction.

Our Story:

Our journey began in 2012 with a vision to revolutionize the publisher video platform industry. Leveraging cutting-edge machine learning and AI technology, we empower publishers worldwide to maximize revenue through comprehensive tools for video content ownership and monetization. Our platform offers leading global publishers unmatched capabilities in ad serving, monetization strategies, content automation, and personalized video recommendations.

Trusted by top publishers such as The Arena Group, CBSi, Hearst, Nasdaq, VICE, and others, our platform enhances audience engagement and drives revenue growth. Our success is driven by a dedicated global team and supported by visionary backers including The Walt Disney Company, Saban Ventures, Viola Group, 83North, and Firstime Ventures.

In short, You will:

Collaborate with managers across departments to understand their business insights needs, including metrics tracking, dashboard creation, and report generation.
Define and monitor KPIs, conduct deep data analysis to uncover opportunities, and deliver actionable insights to drive business success.
Develop, implement, and maintain impactful dashboards, reports, and metrics, ensuring data integrity and validity.
Present findings and recommendations clearly to key stakeholders across the company.
Manage multiple projects and clients simultaneously in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.
Work closely with operations, data, R&D, finance, and other teams within the organization.

It would be great if you have:

6+ years of experience as a Data/Business Analyst, specializing in quantitative and statistical analysis.
Extensive experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, etc.
Strong business acumen and proficiency in SQL and Excel for data manipulation and analysis.
Proven expertise in A/B testing methodology with a track record of impactful testing outcomes.
Ability to translate complex quantitative analyses into clear, precise, and visually appealing insights to support decision-making.
Strong problem-solving skills, quick learning ability, and a proactive approach to project completion.

It would be AMAZING if you have:

Background in a high-tech company environment.
Experience in the ad-tech industry with a focus on monetization optimization.
Knowledge of Python for data analysis and manipulation.
Familiarity with big data tools such as BigQuery, Athena, etc.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Contract to Hire

On-site (Seattle, Washington OR Phoenix, AZ)




Our client's Supply Chain team is seeking an experienced candidate to identify, create, develop and integrate innovative solutions and programs that lead to improvements in our warehousing and distribution network. This position will lead the development and execution of new logistics initiatives designed to improve overall efficiency and meet the ever-growing demand for storage of bulk inventory in our strategically located distribution centers. The successful candidate will have strong data mining and modeling skills and is comfortable facilitating ideas and working from concept through to execution.




Key Job Responsibilities :

• Retrieving and analyzing data using Excel, SQL, Access and other data management systems

• Writing high quality SQL codes to retrieve and analyze data

• Monitoring existent metrics, analyzing data and partnering with internal teams to identify process and system improvement opportunities

• Designing and implementing reporting solutions to enable stakeholders to manage the business and make effective decisions

• Manage complex calendars and scheduling with diplomacy and discretion, manage domestic travel, expense report coordination and submission, and organize, execute, and assist with team activities

• Drive small to medium operational enhancement projects

• Excellent problem-solving, task prioritization, follow-up, and customer service skills




**This role may be required to work nights, weekends, and holidays**

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
Assist in creating and driving business value and growth though the effective use of Sheetz’ most valuable resource: Data. Responsible for leading Sheetz’ data and information strategy through data analysis and visualization in order to facilitate and enhance organizational decision-making and data utilization across the company. Provides advanced data analytics support to the Senior Data Analyst while providing mentorship to the Data Analyst I around data analytics and information strategy.




RESPONSIBILITIES (other duties may be assigned)




Cultivate data-driven insights that help support exploitation of strategic and tactical business opportunities, and be a champion for a data-driven, decision-making culture.
Support data strategy leadership in the development, assessment, refinement and implementation of corporate strategy through effective use of data analytics.
Provide enterprise-wide data science and business intelligence services as well as recommendations to decentralized, embedded data scientists and analysts throughout the business.
Assist Senior Data Analysts and management in providing training for departmental and distributed data analysts.
Oversee and present robust ad-hoc reports, data models, and deep dive analysis to provide clear observations so that managers can make more informed decisions.
Develop and mentor future data-driven, analytical leaders and strategists within the team.
Assist with a wide array of analytical tasks and projects requested by other departments.
Supports the Senior Data Analyst position with ad-hoc advanced analytics.
Assist in the creation of policies and procedures for the access, analysis and visualization of data and associated business insights; partnering with IT and RISC.
Responsible for the documenting and classifying data assets and making accessible and discoverable across the organization.




QUALIFICATIONS




(Equivalent combinations of education, licenses, certifications and/or experience may be considered)







Education

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial /Data / Computer Science or related field required

Experience

Minimum 3 years demonstrated experience in data modeling, optimization, and application to business strategies required.
Minimum 3 years demonstrated experience in integrating complex, inter-departmental processes and information strategies, and/or designing strategic metrics and scorecards required.
Thorough understanding of the latest data mining, machine learning and/or artificial intelligence techniques required.
In-depth experience with or coursework in designing and implementing information solutions required.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial /Data / Computer Science or related field required

Experience

  • Minimum 3 years demonstrated experience in data modeling, optimization, and application to business strategies required.
  • Minimum 3 years demonstrated experience in integrating complex, inter-departmental processes and information strategies, and/or designing strategic metrics and scorecards required.
  • Thorough understanding of the latest data mining, machine learning and/or artificial intelligence techniques required.
  • In-depth experience with or coursework in designing and implementing information solutions required.

Title: Analyst-Data Analytics
Description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.

With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.

At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.

Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.

The ‘Commercial Data Quality & Data Products Analytics’ Team is part of the Analytics, Investments and Marketing Enablement (AIM) team within Global Commercial Services Marketing, American Express. AIM team is responsible for targeting, acquiring, engaging, and retaining commercial customers over online and offline channels and delivering world-class analytics, insights and data products for the Global Commercial Services (GCS) business. In this role, you will be challenged with enriching the quality of commercial data elements for usage in targeting and creating world class data products by leveraging machine learning and other advanced methodologies. The person will perform data analysis, strategy, synthesize conclusions, and present insights to drive business outcomes. The position is part of a highly collaborative environment, interacting with and influencing partners across Global Commercial Services.

Responsibilities:


Create and implement analytical solutions on enriching data quality for usage across analytics and targeting.
Create innovative data products encompassing commercial prospect and customer targeting use-cases, to drive profitable acquisition and engagement strategy (few examples of data products include - Product/Channel Propensity, Best Time to Call or Lead Quality Index (LQI), identifying commercial expense categories etc.)
Work with external data vendors to evaluate external data for small businesses incl. signals, inflection points and establish the proof of concept on investing in purchasing the data to improve/enrich commercial targeting.
Collaborate with Decision Science and Capabilities teams to build analytical solutions to improve coverage & accuracy of key data elements which are critical inputs into models and marketing/Sales campaigns.


Minimum Qualifications


Master's Degree or MBA, in a quantitative field (e.g. Finance, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Economics)
Excellent SAS/SQL Skills and experience of working with large and unstructured data.
Strong programming skills (C, C++, JAVA, Python, R etc.)
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Familiarity with recommendation systems such as collaborative filtering, k-nearest neighbors, association rules, market basket analysis, SVD (singular value decomposition), and matrix factorization methods
Experience working with very large datasets using Big Data tools and platforms (Hadoop, PIG/HIVE/Mahout)
Strong working knowledge of data mining techniques, including regression analysis, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, SVM (support vector machines)


Preferred Qualifications


Familiarity with recommendation systems such as collaborative filtering, k-nearest neighbors, association rules, market basket analysis, SVD (singular value decomposition), and matrix factorization methods


Salary Range: $60,000.00 to $110,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits

The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

Depending on factors such as business unit requirements, the nature of the position, cost and applicable laws, American Express may provide visa sponsorship for certain positions.

We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:


Competitive base salaries
Bonus incentives
6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need
20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy
Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
Career development and training opportunities


For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst

Location: Tampa FL




Candidate must have detailed experience as Data Analyst and into BA domain

The JD will be Business Analyst role with domain knowledge on

Data (all of data needs – data mapping, data quality, governance, lineage, metrics, data tables and columns understanding and create curated data layers for KPI’s and aggregation, SORs/ARs etc.) and
Wealth domain(Private Banking).

As part of Intake, Business Engagement & Solution team, the following activities will be involved and hence the person should be able to cover all aspects – Business requirement discussions with Business, High Level solution, Estimation/Sizing, User story creation and grooming, authoring FR, review FR with Business and tech teams to get signoff, working with TPM, Tech team on execution sprint, Test scenarios review, Pre-production test cases creation and validation.

Title: Jr. Data Analyst
Description:
We are UMG, the Universal Music Group. We are the world’s leading music company. In everything we do, we are committed to artistry, innovation and entrepreneurship. We own and operate a broad array of businesses engaged in recorded music, music publishing, merchandising, and audiovisual content in more than 60 countries. We identify and develop recording artists and songwriters, and we produce, distribute and promote the most critically acclaimed and commercially successful music to delight and entertain fans around the world.

Universal Music Group Nashville (UMGN) is currently seeking an Junior Data Analyst. This position will work within the Data & Research Team to build practical and creative data engineering solutions to fulfill business requests. This role will work closely with the Dir, Data & Research to provide precise reporting and necessary business tools for Universal Music Group Nashville. The position requires a strong skill set in mining, testing, and analyzing data.

How We LEAD


Own the creation of key data sets that drive existing and future internal reporting tools within Universal Music Group Nashville (UMGN).
Provide practical and creative data engineering solutions on large sets of data.
Support the Data & Research Team on data initiatives, ensuring optimal data delivery for all projects.
Communicate data-driven insights and recommendations within the Data & Research Team.
Liaison with Corporate Data team to stay informed and up to date on latest data and analytic tools available internally and externally.
Other additional duties and responsibilities as needed.


How You'll CREATE


Coding experience with SQL or a similar product suite is required.
Experience extracting data from data lake is required.
A direct background and current position with a heavy use of data analytics.
A passion for data, especially for creating efficient and scalable models
Advanced user of Microsoft Office Suite with heavy Excel work required.
A rabid desire to acquire knowledge from anywhere, whether related parallel industries to highly unlikely sources, and apply it to our situation with constant trial and error.
A relaxed and confident approach to all business relationships internally and externally.
Familiarity with music industry consumption (music streaming partners) is a plus.


Bring Your VIBE


Ideally, 2 years of experience using databases and analytic tools to build business solutions
Undergraduate or technical degree with highly relevant background required.


Perks Playlist


Be part of an entrepreneurial, global organization that values authenticity, drive, creativity, relationships, and a competitive spirit
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and FSA options, as well as:
100% coverage for out-patient mental health services
Wellbeing reimbursements for fitness classes, spa treatments, meal services, travel, and so much more (up to $720/year)
A lifetime fertility support allowance of $30,000 to plan participants
Student Loan Repayment Assistance and Tuition Reimbursement
100% immediately vested 401(k) match on the first 5% of your contribution on eligible compensation


Variety of ways to prioritize much-needed time away from work including:
Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) for exempt employees
3-weeks PTO for non-exempt employees
2-weeks paid Winter Break
10 Company Holidays (including Juneteenth and Wellbeing Day)
Summer Fridays (between Memorial Day and Labor Day)
Generous paid parental leave for every type of parent

Check out our full overview of benefits on the Perks Playlist page of the career site.

Disclaimer: This job description only provides an overview of job responsibilities that are subject to change.

Universal Music Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer

We are an E-Verify employer in Alabama, Arizona, Georgia, Mississippi, North Carolina, South Carolina, Tennessee, and Utah.

For more information, please click on the following links.

E-Verify Participation Poster: English / Spanish

E-Verify Right to Work Poster: English | Spanish

Job Category

Data, Analytics & Business Intelligence

Salary Range

$48,230 - $55,120

The actual base salary offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include, as applicable, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, specific and unique skills, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job. All candidates are encouraged to apply.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

We are looking for a driven, early career individual, with a passion for analytics and innovation to join us in turning the largest cardiovascular database in the US into meaningful and impactful insights. As an Associate Data Analyst, your success will be measured by the quality and actionable nature of our analytics deliverables to hospital customers. Your contributions will have the ability to save real patients’ lives and propel egnite to the next state of evolution.




The ideal candidate has at least 2 years of experience in an analytics role, has an eye for detail, and a quantitative and creative mindset. This individual will bring strong communication, strong work ethic, and team-player attitude to help tackle any task, executing on the nuts and bolts of our ‘get it done’ culture. The candidate should know SQL and be prepared to rapidly acquire new analytical and technical skills on the job including Kaplan Meir analysis and data manipulation using python in a big data environment (Databricks).




Duties and Responsibilities:




Strategic thinking to generate impactful insights that benefit patients and hospitals
Development of new analyses using python and SQL and presenting those results internally via PowerPoint Presentation
Clear communication of data to our customer reporting team, ensuring they're equipped with the necessary detail to support groundbreaking insights in customer meetings
Analyze large data sets to identify trends and patterns
Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Stay up-to-date with new data analysis techniques and tools
Assist in data cleaning, preprocessing, and data wrangling
Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify key variables and insights




This role requires privileged access controls for critical systems or data, ensuring that only authorized employees have access to sensitive information to help prevent data breaches and unauthorized access to sensitive information.




Education and experience:

A bachelor’s degree in a business or quantitative field – Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Biology, Finance, or related field.
At least 2 years of experience in a data analytics role
Experience with SQL and databases required
A talent for data driven story-telling and executive message development
PowerBi, Databricks, pyspark, and/or R, preferred
A passion for making a difference in the world – in our case, helping patients
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Natural curiosity, eagerness to learning, and willing to self-study to gain expertise in cardiovascular clinical and hospital administration topics
Team player excited by the prospect of shared successes in collaboration with our clinical client success team and hospital customers
Strong attention to detail and organization skills
Comfortable with statistical concepts
Location flexibility within the United States, with occasional travel (up to 5%) to our headquarters in Orange County or to support customer presentations
Work authorization in the United States




egnite is a rapidly growing digital healthcare company dedicated to improving care for heart disease patients. Our vision is to create an evolved healthcare landscape in which data, technology, patients, and clinical expertise are at the intersection of healthcare transformation - simply put, we want to improve the care for every heart patient across the US.




At egnite, we take security seriously, and it plays a role in all jobs within our organization. We believe that every employee has a responsibility to help maintain a secure and safe work environment, protect our company’s assets and reputation, and safeguard our customers’ data and privacy. Therefore, all employees are expected to comply with our security policies and procedures, and to report any security incidents or concerns promptly.




Please note that some positions may require additional security clearances or certifications, depending on the nature of the job and the level of access to sensitive information. If such requirements exist, they will be clearly stated in the job description, and all applicants will be expected to meet these requirements as a condition of employment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Como nuestro próximo Data Analyst desempeñarás un papel crucial dentro del equipo de Content Strategy and Analysis, contribuyendo a la generación de insights que guiarán las decisiones estratégicas de la empresa. Esta posición es fundamental para analizar las tendencias de la industria musical y el performance de nuestros artistas en las diversas plataformas digitales.

 

Principales responsabilidades:




Análisis de datos para extraer insights que respalden decisiones estratégicas.
Identificar tendencias emergentes y oportunidades de crecimiento dentro del repertorio musical de Sony Music.
Monitorear y analizar el desempeño de nuestros artistas en plataformas digitales como Spotify, TikTok, Apple Music, Amazon Music, YouTube, etc.
Evaluar la efectividad de las campañas de marketing digital, integrando métricas de publicidad con patrones de consumo.
Desarrollar presentaciones y visualizaciones impactantes para comunicar insights complejos de manera efectiva y comprensible.
Comunicarse estrechamente con los equipos de Marketing y A&R en la recopilación y aplicación de insights.




Requisitos:

Título universitario en Ingeniería Industrial, Ciencia de Datos, Análisis de Negocios, un campo relacionado, o experiencia práctica equivalente.
Experiencia mínima de uno a dos años en análisis de datos.
Inglés avanzado

(Indispensable)

Dominio avanzado de Microsoft Excel
Buen dominio de SQL
Lenguaje de programación: Python
Herramientas de visualización de datos como Tableau, Power BI
Microsoft Office: PowerPoint avanzado




Cualidades:

Pasión profunda por la música
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita
Capacidad para comunicar ideas técnicas a audiencias no técnicas
Proactividad y trabajo en equipo
Fuertes habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas.
Sólida capacidad de visualización de datos.
Curioso y automotivado.




Ofrecemos:

Contrato directo con Sony Music México
Salario competitivo y paquete de beneficios atractivo
Prestaciones superiores de ley (Fondo de ahorro, vales de despensa, Gastos médicos mayores, Seguro de vida, Bono de productividad)




¡Únete a nosotros y conviértete en parte de un equipo innovador!













Show more

  • Contrato directo con Sony Music México
  • Salario competitivo y paquete de beneficios atractivo
  • Prestaciones superiores de ley (Fondo de ahorro, vales de despensa, Gastos médicos mayores, Seguro de vida, Bono de productividad)


¡Únete a nosotros y conviértete en parte de un equipo innovador!

Description:
Required Skills & Experience




- Bachelor's Degree in related field

- Experience identifying discrepancies in data, quality control management, and effective communication skills to stakeholders

Job Description

Title: Analyst, Reporting & Analytics
Description:
At Revlon, we create beauty innovations for everyone that inspire confidence and ignite joy every day.

Breaking beauty boundaries is in our company’s DNA. Since its game-changing launch of the first opaque nail enamel in 1932 (and later, the first long-wear foundation), Revlon has provided consumers with high-quality product innovation, performance, and sophisticated glamour. Elizabeth Arden made waves as a woman-led beauty company in the 1920s. In 1931, Almay became the original hypoallergenic, fragrance-free beauty brand.

Today, Revlon resiliently continues its legacy as a leading global beauty company. Our diverse portfolio—which consists of some of the world’s most iconic brands and product offerings in color cosmetics, skin care, hair color & care, personal care, and fragrances—is sold around the world through prestige, professional, mass, and direct-to-consumer retail channels. These brands include Revlon, Revlon Professional, Elizabeth Arden, Almay, American Crew, CND, Cutex, Mitchum, Sinful Colors, Creme of Nature, Britney Spears, Christina Aguilera, John Varvatos, Juicy Couture, Ed Hardy and more.

We honor our heritage, embrace change, and applaud diversity. We champion our employees and celebrate our consumers.

We are Revlon, together, transforming beauty.

Position Overview

Revlon’s growing Analytics, Insights, & Business Intelligence team has an opening for a deeply curious and self-motivated Analyst, Reporting and Analytics. The Analyst, Reporting and Analytics will serve as Revlon’s syndicated data expert & will provide reporting support for the organization. This role involves collaborating with cross-functional leaders across all Revlon brands and functions.

We want you to take initiative, think strategically, and foster intellectual curiosity throughout the team and organization. This role reports to the Director of Analytics, Insights, & Business Intelligence and will be on-site (NYC) 3 days a week (remote Mondays and Fridays).

Job Responsibilities


Syndicated data review & analysis (Circana, Euromonitor, Mintel)
Drive reporting solutions adoption and trainings
Support reporting and insights across the organization
Assist on strategic projects
Anticipate business and research needs resourcefully, understanding both the big picture and the nuances of the business.
Turn data into actionable insights, cutting through data clutter to deliver unique insights that drive our growth agenda.
Work with cross-functional stakeholders across all Revlon brands.
Integrate data from multiple sources (primary, secondary, and syndicated) to drive ideation of brand strategy and executional tactics.


Experience


1-3 years of experience in research, trends, or analytics
Advanced proficiency working with syndicated datasets (Circana or Nielsen) - required
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and provide actionable insights.
Proficiency, or aptitude to learn, PowerBI
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel & Powerpoint
Self-motivated, hard-working, and strategic thinker with strong time management skills and the ability to prioritize competing deadlines. Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment to drive brand and financial goals.
Self-starter – able to meet with teams on their own
Current authorization to work in the United States on a full-time basis


Education

Bachelor’s degree required

The base pay range for this position in New York City is $70,000 - $95,000; however base pay offered may vary depending on skills, experience, job-related knowledge, and location. Certain positions may also be eligible for short and/or long-term incentives as part of total compensation.

Employees (and their families) are eligible for medical, dental, and vision benefits. Employees are covered by the company-paid basic life insurance policy. Other benefits offered to employees include but are not limited to the following: long-term disability, supplemental life insurances, flexible spending accounts, critical illness insurance, group legal, identity theft protection, etc. Employees are also able to enroll in our 401k Retirement Savings Plan.

Employees are also enrolled in our company-paid short-term disability insurance (the benefit commences upon hire and allows for a portion of base salary for up to 26 weeks if you are disabled).

Employees will also receive 3 weeks of vacation, pro-rated based on date of hire for the 1st year of employment and twelve paid holidays throughout the calendar year.

This role is eligible for an annual bonus based on company performance.

Other benefits offered to employees include but are not limited to the following: long-term disability, supplemental life insurances, flexible spending accounts, critical illness insurance, group legal, identity theft protection, etc. Employees are also able to enroll in our 401k Retirement Savings Plan.

Employees are also enrolled in our company-paid short-term disability insurance (the benefit commences upon hire and allows for a portion of base salary for up to 26 weeks if you are disabled).

Employees will also receive 3 weeks of vacation, pro-rated based on date of hire for the 1st year of employment and twelve paid holidays throughout the calendar year.

This role is eligible for an annual bonus based on company performance.

Title: Excel Data Analyst
Description:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Duluth, GA (preferred) or Atlanta, GA (windy hill road area)

Employment Type: 6-12 Contract (3 days per week in-office)




About the Role:

We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our customer intelligence team. This role is crucial for centralizing and managing customer data from independently owned, each with its own customer accounts. Your analysis will help shape a cohesive customer journey and enhance our digital marketing strategies.




Responsibilities:

Centralize and manage customer data from various stores.
Analyze and understand customer data to identify completeness, opportunities, and potential merges.
Work with five teams focused on customer data to ensure a unified customer understanding.
Perform complex SQL queries using Google BigQuery.
Create dashboards and reports using Power BI to support product teams.
Collaborate with product personnel to understand and fulfill data requirements.




Qualifications:

Proficient in Google BigQuery.
Advanced SQL skills are a must.
Experience with Power BI for dashboard creation desired
Strong analytical skills to understand and interpret complex data sets.
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams and support other customer domain teams.




If you are a data analyst with a knack for handling complex customer data and providing insightful analysis, we would love to hear from you!




The hourly pay rate range for this position is $50 to $65 / hour (dependent on factors including but not limited to client requirements, experience, statutory considerations, and location). Benefits available to full-time employees: medical, dental, vision, disability, life insurance, 401k and commuter benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by the Equal Pay for Equal Work Act (CO), NYC Pay Transparency Law, and sb5761 (WA)




Synergis is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, age, gender, gender identity, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, military/veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law.




For immediate consideration, please forward your resume to christy.cifreo@synergishr.com




If you require assistance or an accommodation in the application or employment process, please contact us at christy.cifreo@synergishr.com




Synergis is a workforce solutions partner serving thousands of businesses and job seekers nationwide. Our digital world has accelerated the need for businesses to build IT ecosystems that enable growth and innovation along with enhancing the Total Experience (TX). Synergis partners with our clients at the intersection of talent and transformation to scale their balanced teams of tech, digital and creative professionals. Learn more about Synergis at www.synergishr.com.

Title: Data Analyst, Core Systems
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
1 year of experience in technical troubleshooting and writing code in one or more programming languages.
Experience in technical project management, stakeholder management, professional services, solution engineering, or technical consulting.
Experience with SQL, Data Analysis, Data Analytics, Dashboards, and ETL Tools.


Preferred qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (Business, Math/Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or similar).
1 year of experience in data analysis or a related field.
Experience working with large and complex datasets. Demonstrated experience in using SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis.
Experience in building and maintaining data pipelines using tools like Apache Airflow or similar.
Experience working with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into actionable insights.
Proficiency in any one of the data visualization tool (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Data Studio).


About The Job

As a Technical Solutions Consultant, you will be responsible for the technical relationship of our largest advertising clients and/or product partners. You will lead cross-functional teams in Engineering, Sales and Product Management to leverage emerging technologies for our external clients/partners. From concept design and testing to data analysis and support, you will oversee the technical execution and business operations of Google's online advertising platforms and/or product partnerships.

You will be able to balance business and partner needs with technical constraints, develop innovative, cutting edge solutions and act as a partner and consultant to those you are working with. You will also be able to build tools and automate products, oversee the technical execution and business operations of Google's partnerships, as well as develop product strategy and prioritize projects and resources.

The Core team builds the technical foundation behind Google’s flagship products. We are owners and advocates for the underlying design elements, developer platforms, product components, and infrastructure at Google. These are the essential building blocks for excellent, safe, and coherent experiences for our users and drive the pace of innovation for every developer. We look across Google’s products to build central solutions, break down technical barriers and strengthen existing systems. As the Core team, we have a mandate and a unique opportunity to impact important technical decisions across the company.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $94,500-$139,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.

Responsibilities


Develop and execute complex SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data from various sources. Design and build interactive dashboards that effectively communicate key insights and trends to stakeholders.
Craft data-driven narratives that guide users through dashboards, uncovering meaningful insights and actionable recommendations through user-centric experiences.
Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines to collect, process, and integrate data from disparate sources.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity throughout the pipeline, implementing validation and error-handling procedures. Automate data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes to improve efficiency and reduce manual effort.
Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including product managers, engineers, and business leaders, to gather requirements, prioritize projects, and deliver actionable insights.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Predictive Data Analyst
Description:
Position Description

The Predictive Data Analyst will support stakeholders by defining data needs and ensuring data science projects meet business objectives across various levels. The role involves using statistical programming languages and tools for data manipulation, analysis, and visualization, including end-to-end predictive modeling from exploratory analysis to deployment and results interpretation.

Key Tasks


Managing data through querying, cleaning, merging, quality control, regular reporting, special project deliverables, and documentation.
Collaboration with IT staff to develop data pipelines, design and maintain reports and dashboards, and work with program staff to ensure analyses lead to actionable insights for decision-making and program improvement.
Strong background in predictive analytics and tool development is essential.
Customer experience working directly with a client-centric relational database and managing individuals.
Strong technical knowledge and comfortable doing analyses and building reports from an SQL database.
The analyst should be comfortable with various analytical tools and have taken the lead on projects where the best path forward is unclear. Customer service mindset.


Experience Required


4 years of experience with responsibility for planning, designing, conducting, and evaluating research projects involving the application of techniques of machine learning, predictive analytics, data management, and hypothesis-driven data analysis to complex experimental designs, leading to actionable findings and recommendations.


Education Required

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in a field of applied research such as Data Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Analytics, Psychology, or Public Health that includes 12 semester or 18 quarter units of coursework in data science, predictive analytics, quantitative research methods, or statistical analysis.

Trinus Corporation, a leading provider of technology solutions and services with over 25 years of experience, is a certified WBE/MBE/SBE/SDB firm accredited by WBENC, NMSDC, and SBA.

Our mission is to shape the future of work by aligning the right mix of people, process, technology, and innovation to efficiently meet our clients' business objectives.

At Trinus, we understand that finding the right opportunity is pivotal in your career journey. Our staffing services go beyond mere placements; they are about matching your skills and aspirations with the perfect fit.

To learn more about us, please visit our website www.trinus.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

FLSA Status: Non-Exempt

Reports to: Director of IT




We are a mission-driven law firm dedicated to assisting Americans in overcoming financial challenges. Our inhouse IT team plays a critical role in all aspects of our daily work including streamlining our workflow and enhancing operational efficiency.




We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst who has great working knowledge with SQL and data visualization to join our team. It is imperative that this person is comfortable and well versed in working collaboratively and cross functionally with other departments. The IT team supports all functions of the business, communication skills are paramount.




You will be responsible for managing data, generating reports, and providing valuable insights to support decision-making across the organization. This position requires strong technical expertise in SQL, attention to detail, problem-solving abilities, relationship building and a commitment to our mission and values.




Key Responsibilities:

Data Management and Analysis:

Utilize SQL and other relevant tools to extract, build, manipulate, and analyze data from various sources.
Develop and maintain data models, databases, and data warehouses to support reporting and analysis.
Identify and address data quality issues, ensuring accuracy and integrity of data.




Reporting and Insights:

Design and generate reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate key metrics and insights.
Analyze data trends, patterns, and anomalies to identify opportunities for improvement and optimization.
Provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis to support strategic decision-making.




Cross-Functional Collaboration:

Collaborate with other teams, departments & the C-suite and to understand data requirements and business needs.
Work closely with the executive team to provide data-driven insights and support organizational goals.
Partner with IT colleagues to integrate data solutions and systems across the organization.




Problem Solving and Error Identification:

Proactively identify and address data discrepancies, errors, and issues.
Troubleshoot technical problems related to data extraction, transformation, and reporting.
Develop and implement solutions to enhance data accuracy, efficiency, and usability.




Mission Alignment and Attitude:

Embrace and uphold the mission and values of the law firm, demonstrating a genuine commitment to helping individuals achieve financial freedom.
Maintain a positive and collaborative attitude while working with cross-functional teams.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders to understand their needs and deliver high-quality solutions.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or a related field.
Strong working knowledge of SQL and experience with database management systems required (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL). Other languages helpful, however SQL is prominent.
Proficiency in reporting tools.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with team members and superiors.
Experience working in a mission-driven organization or a passion for serving others is preferred.




Join our dynamic and mission-focused team, where you'll have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact while utilizing your technical expertise and analytical skills. We work on-site in our Financial District office Monday-Thursday and remotely on Fridays. If you're ready to contribute to our mission of helping Americans get out of debt, we encourage you to apply!




Compensation: Starting salary range of $50,000 – $65,000 depending on relevant experience. We hold bi-annual performance reviews to ensure we are actively identifying top performers, providing formal feedback and assessing merit increases.




How to Apply: To apply for this position, please submit your resume and a member of our team will reach out to you. We appreciate all applications, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.




EEO Compliance: Consumer Legal Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, or veteran status.
