Title: Data Analyst III - Provider Compensation
Description:
Atrius Health, an innovative healthcare leader, delivers an effective system of connected care for more than 690,000 adult and pediatric patients at 30 medical practice locations in eastern Massachusetts. Atrius Health’s 645 physicians and primary care providers, along with 420 additional clinicians, work in close collaboration with hospital partners, community specialists and skilled nursing facilities. Our vision is to transform care to improve lives. Atrius Health provides high-quality, patient-centered, coordinated, cost effective care to every patient we serve. By establishing a solid foundation of shared decision making, understanding and trust with each of its patients, Atrius Health enhances their health and enriches their lives. Atrius Health is part of Optum, a health services company focused on building the leading value-based care system in the country.




SUMMARY

Under general direction and as part of a high performing integrated compensation team, performs full scope of activities associated with the design, development, and administration of assigned programs. Manages projects, coordinates activities, and prepares recommendations requiring a broad and thorough understanding of provider compensation design, techniques, methods, and market practices. Serves as internal consultant to assigned functions and/or business units (service lines), providing consultative and analytic support on issues relating to a range of compensation programs and practices. Provides guidance and makes recommendations as needed. As part of the provider compensation team, ensures consistency in implementation and legal compliance of pay practices across the organization. Partners with HR, finance, and business leaders to ensure business needs and objectives are met with best-in-class compensation programs.




GENERAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

· Primary point person for assigned functions, business units (service lines) and departments. Utilizes thorough understanding of compensation models and the local and national market to guide local decision-making on full range of compensation matters.

· Participates in design, implementation, and administration of all provider compensation programs. Includes the gathering and manipulating data, calculating compensation, processing changes and payments, and reporting out to individuals and other stakeholders.

· Prepares reports and analyses, including assessments of program affordability and cost to implement. Evaluates proposals for new programs. Monitors effectiveness of on-going programs and makes recommendations for future initiatives. Ensures programs are following federal, state, and local laws.

· Maintains databases in excel and access to support provider compensation programs.

· Ensures the integrity and accuracy of data. Identifies any discrepancies in the data and if data is not being captured correctly, works with the appropriate members of IT or Business Systems Analysts to resolve the issue, and ensure that the data is accurate, and the data integrity is maintained.

· Interacts and consults with the appropriate internal and external parties to ensure an understanding of factors that affect the business data and possible sources of variation. Acts as an independent consultant, providing guidance in data analysis to members of other departments and/or senior management.

· Participates in data collection, submission, and evaluation of compensation surveys.

· Conducts market analysis for physicians and APCs using survey data and guidelines.

· Conducts assessment and review of compensation issues (e.g., salary offers for new hires, new hires, or promotions).

· Develops administrative process to support variable pay needs of specific business groups and the organization.

· Maintain databases that support provider compensation functions.




SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

· May mentor and direct the work of other compensation team members or junior analysts. basis.

EDUCATION/LICENSES/CERTIFICATIONS

BS/BA preferably in business, finance, human resource management, or data analytics (or equivalent education, training, or experience).

EXPERIENCE

Five to seven years of compensation experience including program development, design, analysis, and implementation required.




Atrius Health is committed to a policy of non-discrimination and equal employment opportunity. All patients, employees, applicants, and other constituents of Atrius Health will be treated with respect and dignity regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, veteran status, marital/domestic partner status, parental status, sexual orientation, and gender identity and/or expression, or other dimensions of diversity.

Benefits Include:

· Up to 8% company retirement contribution

· Generous Paid Time Off

· 10 paid holidays

· Paid professional development

· Generous health and welfare benefit package

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Integrity Lab creates intelligent technology to foster integrity within the world’s leading organizations. Our data-driven advisory team analytically investigates the most pressing integrity challenges facing organizations, including fraud, bribery, and harassment. We employ cutting-edge approaches to proactively mitigate misconduct.




Our Cambridge-based team, led by a Harvard Business School Professor, has diverse expertise in data science, statistics, econometrics, engineering, and software design. We routinely support organizations facing significant public and regulatory scrutiny.




We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our innovative and dynamic team. In this role, you will partner with industry-leading US multinationals to solve their critical compliance analytics needs. You will have the opportunity to work with rich, proprietary datasets to generate actionable managerial insights. You will communicate complex data insights through visualizations, reports, and presentations to senior stakeholders at our clients. You will further contribute to groundbreaking internal research projects to shape the future of compliance analytics.




This role would be especially well suited for a candidate who wants to pursue a graduate degree in a quantitative social science field.




What you’ll do

Draw inferences about behavior and organizational culture using various data techniques
Independently manage a diverse range of datasets, including conducting preliminary and exploratory analysis, merging datasets, and creating clear documentation.
Develop and present clear, concise visualizations to showcase findings
Communicate findings to internal and external stakeholders, including C-Suite leaders, through memos and presentations.
Collaborate on innovative R&D projects to shape the future of compliance and organizational culture analytics




What we’re looking for from you

An exceptional academic record with a bachelor's in Economics, Statistics, or a related quantitative field.
2-4 years of experience in quantitative data analysis, preferably within a consulting or tech environment.
Proficiency in Python for data analysis and modeling.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present data findings clearly and concisely.
Self-starter comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment.




Some nice to-haves

Knowledge of Stata is highly desirable.
Experience in consulting, particularly in projects related to organizational culture or compliance.




What we offer

Competitive compensation package
A collaborative environment with a kind, dedicated, friendly team
The opportunity to engage in meaningful work that tackles significant integrity challenges facing organizations today
Opportunities for professional development, training, and career progression.
Paid time off
Health, vision, and dental insurance
401k plan




We value diverse viewpoints, and we do not discriminate based on one’s race, creed, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, handicap, disability, veteran status, or military obligations.

Show more

Title: Business / Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities:


Defines business/system requirements by facilitating user meetings and interviewing users, developing use cases, and researching and resolving issues.
Participates in business analysis project planning and management by documenting and maintaining plans, managing issue logs and preparing project documentation.
Analyzes current processes and recommends solutions and improved processes.
May also oversee the acquisition, analysis and dissemination of subject matter knowledge.
Provides technical and business knowledge to clients.
Keeps abreast of technological and competitive developments.
Conducts research on industry practices and standards and other benchmarking data.
Codes and maintains business application programs from user instructions or formal functional specifications.


Experience:


Experience in the analysis and testing phases in the development cycle.
In addition having experience of 3 to 6 years.


Compensation:

The pay rate range above is the base hourly pay range that Aditi Consulting reasonably expects to pay someone for this position (compensation may vary outside of this range depending on several factors, including but not limited to, a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, experience, location and end client requirements).

Benefits and Ancillaries:

Medical, dental, vision, PTO benefits and ancillaries may be available for eligible Aditi Consulting employees and vary based on the plan options selected by the employee.

Aditi Consulting LLC uses AI technology to engage candidates during the sourcing process. AI technology is used to gather data only and does not replace human-based decision making in employment decisions.

Title: Junior Power BI Data Analyst - Contract
Description:
Junior Power BI Data Analyst

Framingham, MA, Hybrid (2 days in office) If needed (Remote)

3 Month Contract with potential extension

36.25 hours a week

Looking for a junior level data analyst with 3-5 years of exp and exp with Power BI - will be moving reports over into Power BI....


Recognize business requirements in the context of BI and create data models to transform raw data into relevant insights
Using Power BI, create dashboards and interactive visual reports
Define key performance indicators (KPIs) with specific objectives and track them regularly
Analyze data and display it in reports to aid decision-making
Convert business needs into technical specifications and establish a timetable for job completion
Create, test, and deploy Power BI scripts, as well as execute efficient deep analysis
Construct a data warehouse
Use SQL queries to get the best results
Make technological adjustments to current BI systems to improve their performance
For a better understanding of the data, use filters and visualizations


#TB_EN

Job #: 24-11151
